website_summaries.verdict: An eight-inch blade made of strong steel.
pros: Steel blade receives accolades for durability
Includes a blade protector, though it is not fancy
Arrives assembled and ready to go
cons: Perhaps due to the lower price, the build quality of the shaver is sometimes questioned by buyers

customer_reviews.title: Sharp out of the box, holds its edge, ergonomic handle/blade relationship allows comfortable use.
customer_reviews.text: This draw knife was sharp right out of the box. It feels solid (no bending, handle twisting,etc.) and of good quality materials. I’m using it to debark and shape several different types of wood ranging from soft cedar to very hard osage orange. It works well drawing at any speed and with the bevel blade, depth of cut is easy to control. It handles shaving off knots, etc. which take a lot more force than simply shaving bark. It gets the job done. I have no doubts this tool will last and perform well.
customer_reviews.author: DCR

customer_reviews.title: Pick this up, Very good for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great buy it makes me mad that people here claim it isn't a good product because it look like it came straight out of the mill with no edge to it because all draw knifes come dull you have to sharpen them yourself for one, And for two mine came well packaged and when sharpened it held its edge for a 3-4 projects before filling out which isn't bad because each project takes a lot of use of this knife as I make wood crafted bows. I would definitely recommend As it is good quality for a Japanese knife, Though an authentic American draw knifes have the very best quality, This isn't bad
customer_reviews.author: Wesley P.

customer_reviews.title: Nice solid tool!
customer_reviews.text: I touched up the blade with 400 grit wer/dry sandpaper, and it is sharp. Very substantial blade with nicely shaped solid wood handles that are attached very securely. Nice touch to include a blade guard. The only detraction was one spot about 1 1/4 inches where the factory grind on the bade was poorly done. Took a lot of wok to get that resolved and polish out the factory grind scratches. If the factory grind had been better, this would be five stars. I did not consider that to be sufficient reason to give a poor review. Any tool is going to have small issues, and will require the buyer to touch up and sharpen. This is to be expected.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A Great Tool for Woodworkers
customer_reviews.text: Works well... This may sound like a no-brainer... But for those to whom has not used one of these... You should secure the wood before shaving it... You could even shave a tree that you have not cut down yet... This is my attempt of giving a review longer than "Works well"
customer_reviews.author: sketchofthenile

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, comfortable, and works well
customer_reviews.text: This tool is great. Just be aware it doesn’t come fully sharpened and will need some work getting it razor sharp, however that is normal for most cutting tools’ factory edge. I did use it to shave bark off logs right out of the box, and it worked fine, but a sharper edge will make it easier to use. It’s a very durable and well made tool, and after using it quite a bit, I expect it will last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: GM

customer_reviews.title: Totally inferior product
customer_reviews.text: I should have read the description more carefully HRC 30 hardness is no where near sufficient for a cutting tool. As soon as I saw the "Made in China" sticker and the obviously inferior metal, I knew I was in trouble. The metal is extremely poor quality. It has voids making it impossible to sharpen to a consistent edge. It was useless as delivered and after sharpening (a 1 hour long ordeal) it only held an edge for two or three stokes on very soft lumber. Don't waste your money or your time.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Halverson

customer_reviews.title: Some work required.
customer_reviews.text: One of the handles was cracked because it was overtighten and the blade was not really sharp.However I polished the handles and lowered the cutting edge angle over all and now it works well.What is good about this tool are the offset handles and the angle to the wood when cutting-cuts very well and allows good and comfortable control over the depth of each cut.I bought another draw knife here on Amazon and it has a better finish but paralel handles and is horrible compared to this one.
customer_reviews.author: Ogostaboy

customer_reviews.title: This worked great!
customer_reviews.text: I was a little iffy about buying this because of some of the reviews, but I'm glad I bought it anyway. It came sort of semi-sharp like others have stated, but after only a few minutes sharpening, & tightening the nuts on the handles, it was good to go. I used it to scrape the bark off of more than a few logs. It held the edge and did a great job. I have used it daily for over a week and only touch up sharpen when I'm done for the day. I would highly recommend this draw knife.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Good value, good construction.
customer_reviews.text: Sound, sturdy construction make this tool a very good value. Yes, the blade does not come to you sharp "out of the box" and you will have to spend some time sharpening the blade before the initial use, but for the money I think this tool is a great value. I use this tool to strip bark off large pine timbers I'm clearing. This is a comfortable tool that works well for this job.
customer_reviews.author: MBK Farm

customer_reviews.title: Too light weight for effective use.
customer_reviews.text: I just had a small job to do to strip some bark off some cedar logs. I was working away when my friend saw what I was doing. He pulled out his which weighed 3 times as much as this one. What i was struggling to do with this tool, his made the job easy. The principle difference was the weight of his shave tool.
customer_reviews.author: Pam O.

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I bough this because some of the dead trees on my property that I fell and will be putting in my fireplace insert had mold on the bark. This little baby stripped it off great. I did have to sharpen it a few times but I did a lot of wood. I think it is a great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Linam g

customer_reviews.title: Lousy Steel, Arrived Dull.
customer_reviews.text: Out of the box this thing was so dull it would not cut. I sharpened it only to find that within a couple minutes it required sharpening and the reground angle was so high as to dig deep and rip off pieces rather than shave. I don't think I can return it so I am considering heat treating the tool to give it higher strength. Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Sam Derouin

customer_reviews.title: Bark Shaver
customer_reviews.text: I purchased straight & curved bark shaver. I had difficulty using curved one, but this straight blade gives me just the right angle for removing bark easily. Very durable & expect to keep it & be able to use a lifetime.
customer_reviews.author: Tina Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Worked right out of the box
customer_reviews.text: I needed to debark some lumber for carving and this worked great. It was sharp and durable - worked great for me. I am a novice. Used a router to carve the Tiki Pictured after I used the Shave tool to debark. My first one - but I like the look and will perfect it in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Giancarlo Tosi

customer_reviews.title: Good angle on the handles puts the blade at a good angle on the wood.
customer_reviews.text: This tool is well made and the angle of the handles puts the blade at a good angle on the wood. I dressed the edge up with a diamond stone. But then again, I sharpen most new implements and knives after I receive them. I like everything razor sharp!
customer_reviews.author: Gene

customer_reviews.title: nice feel
customer_reviews.text: Obviously made off-shore but works OK for my purposes. Not sure how well it holds an edge but time will tell. Not quite as good as my Dad's old knife but would run a tight 5th.
customer_reviews.author: Relzod

customer_reviews.title: Sharp as a letter opener.
customer_reviews.text: The Timber Tuff draw knife was full when I received it. It does not get sharp due to a thick powder coat paint on the back. About as sharp as a letter opener. I took a heat gun and chisel and scraped the powder coat off. It took a better edge. It’s ok for debating logs but not for making axe handles or furniture. Don’t buy a draw knife with powder coat paint.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: May need a longer blade or different handle angle.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this draw knife for debarking a spot on trees that were to be blazed for a trail system. The blade could be longer or the handles could be angled out more. On large trees my knuckles were dragging against the bark. However, that's on me for buying this size. Otherwise, it appears to be decent quality for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Clancy

customer_reviews.title: Very nice!! Good quality at a good price!!
customer_reviews.text: As with ALL drawblades, this needs sharpened when you get it. Once sharpened it is extremely efficient and easy to use. My husband used a file ( maybe 20 times across?) and it was ready to go. He said that another 20 and it would take off a finger. Lol Very well built; excellent quality. Very pleased!! 😁👍👍⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️
customer_reviews.author: S. Haden

customer_reviews.title: Good Value
customer_reviews.text: This is the first draw blade I've purchased, and I used it on a fairly large piece of live edge black walnut to remove all the layers of bark. The knife was sharp enough to use out of the box, had to tighten one of the bolts to secure one of the handles but it was not defective or a significant issue. Cannot speak to the lifespan, but appears as though it will last me long enough to justify the asking price.
customer_reviews.author: Alec

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Good price and works like intended. Mine did come fully sharpened. Only complaint is that I needed to tighten the bolts half way through the first use, could be easily solved with different hardware/Loctite/etc.
customer_reviews.author: Zachary S.

customer_reviews.title: Balanced and well made.
customer_reviews.text: As others have said it's pretty dull out of box. Took handles off and used my sander to flatten back and grind a very sharp edge. It can shave my arm hair. I've used it to peel cedar and hickory. Plan on making my cedar log railing and will peel them with this.
customer_reviews.author: rrtg

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Used this to strip bark off beetle kill pine logs, these logs became support beams for roof in my earthship greenhouse. We stripped about 12 ten foot long logs (yes my wife used it as well).
customer_reviews.author: eric j weed

customer_reviews.title: Mama Mia, that's a sharp blade!
customer_reviews.text: "Does what is says right on the tin!" Being fairly new to debarking trees/wood, this was a breeze to use. However, you do need to put some elbow greese in it. I deadlift 500lb+ so it's like butter for me 😎
customer_reviews.author: Erick Funte

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item to strip the bark off some soft maple logs. I needed at least one because I had tore down a load bearing wall in my house and wanted something decorative to use as a beam. I had 3 that had been cut about 9 months earlier and 2 that I have freshly cut. The older ones stripped just fine. The green logs however were much easier to strip but a fair amount of drag Mark's were left. The tool doesn't require very much effort and does the job.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Came sharp, seems sturdy!
customer_reviews.text: I just got this today. As soon as I unboxed it I grabbed a stick and sat down at the shave horse to test it (without sharpening it first). Turns out it came already sharp! It was easy to get a nice thin cut and it felt good in my hands. I will probably be buying another once I see how this one stands up to lots of use - by teenagers no less!
customer_reviews.author: Lucy

customer_reviews.title: Works for de-barking slabs.
customer_reviews.text: For a cheapie amazon draw knife this thing works really well for what I need. I use it to de-bark live edge slabs. It works well for me!
customer_reviews.author: Alyssa

customer_reviews.title: Satisfying
customer_reviews.text: I can think of few things more satisfying than debarking a live edge slab. Time will tell if it holds its edge but so far so good.
customer_reviews.author: James P

customer_reviews.title: Almost as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Received draw shave, appeared as described and will work for the small project I purchased it for. Gave rating because the blade shield or protector was not included as in the description. Small detail, but necessary to protect blade and myself. Even with the low price still expect to receive what is advertised and what I paid for.
customer_reviews.author: Blondeegal

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: Blade is at a bad angle and the handles are two different colors. Also not very sharp. Just go get an antique one they work waaaaaay better.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon Mulvihill

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: I use this to help remove bark from various wood types, mostly cedar, apple, ash and sycamore. It is rather dull at first, but still usable. I took mine to a friend who sharpens knives. Or you can use a sharpener for tools (hardware store garden section)
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy and works well.
customer_reviews.text: Works as it should. Stripping logs for live edge furniture. Very solid.
customer_reviews.author: guster

customer_reviews.title: Worst product ever
customer_reviews.text: This was the worst waste of money!!!!!! The blade is not hardened steel so the first time you use it the blade chips and will not hold an edge. Attempting to sharpen with a file was a waste of time
customer_reviews.author: Evan & Trena Linden

customer_reviews.title: Nice tool for the money.
customer_reviews.text: One project done and the tool performed well. A little difficult in tight places but that is not what this tool is designed for. Worked great in the open areas on the log. Left branch pieces on the light, see photo.
customer_reviews.author: Fred Smith

customer_reviews.title: Drawknife
customer_reviews.text: On time, nice price and works great and the handles seem pretty sturdy
customer_reviews.author: Lady

customer_reviews.title: Works great, seems sturdy
customer_reviews.text: So far it has been very easy to use and solid. I may buy another.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen P McCurdy

customer_reviews.title: Good value!
customer_reviews.text: This draw knife was a pleasant surprise. It is a good sturdy and sharp tool for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Donna M. Willard

customer_reviews.title: Good price
customer_reviews.text: Although this is not an heirloom tool it is great for the price
customer_reviews.author: Christopher E.

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: It is a sturdy knife, mine was very sharp, and I like the angle. Very easy to use right out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I used this to smooth out a log to scrape ...
customer_reviews.text: I used this to smooth out a log to scrape deer hides on. it worked very well. Ive thought about using it to smooth out/debark logs for making furniture too. I'm sure it would work really well.
customer_reviews.author: Neil

customer_reviews.title: Dull, but that is what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: If you are wanting a cheap dull draw knife, this is for you. If you want one sharp out of the box go buy a quality draw knife. Handles are pretty loose and require constant tightening.
customer_reviews.author: Gmoney

customer_reviews.title: Cheap Chinese Steel Impossible to Get Sharp
customer_reviews.text: Received dull and with the Chinese steel on it, it’s impossible to get sharp. Not a quality draw knife and don’t use on an important project.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Andrew Monrial

customer_reviews.title: Solid build quality
customer_reviews.text: Little bit overpriced but it seems like a sturdy tool.
customer_reviews.author: Minimalist

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Feels great, sturdy, and gets the job done. You will have to sharpen it out if the box.
customer_reviews.author: Carl O.

customer_reviews.title: Good tool for several uses, debark, smoothor add character.
customer_reviews.text: Arrived quickly. Exactly as advertized. Works well.. Using to "Age" some wood for decorative uses
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worked really good.
customer_reviews.text: This item was made really well and worked great for peeling the bark off the cut wood.
customer_reviews.author: C. Brigham

customer_reviews.title: works well
customer_reviews.text: I havent hogged the heck out of anything yet but I have put a live edge on some of the timber I have used for a recent project. It comes with the blade good enough for rough work but tuning the edge makes this thing work well.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: needs a better edge on the blade.
customer_reviews.text: Not the best of edges on this blade. Needed a little sharpening up. But what do you expect from a china product. Works well with a new edge on it.
customer_reviews.author: Joey

customer_reviews.title: Too bulky
customer_reviews.text: Very thick and hard to keep sharp. I eventually gave up on trying to use it. I would not buy again
customer_reviews.author: Joy

customer_reviews.title: The tool is sturdy with decent handles
customer_reviews.text: Solid tool. The tool is sturdy with decent handles. Mine needed sharpening before it could be useful. For the money it worked great. If you're looking for s high quality draw knife that will hold a razor edge, look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher R. Andrus

customer_reviews.title: Good draw blade
customer_reviews.text: It came sharp and is sturdy. Tried it out. It works great. A small and efficient draw blade.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: My husband and are building a cabin and have had to cut down a few hardwoods that I wanted to save and use. This thing is great and despite the hard labor required for this tool it definitely made it easier to peel the bark off the tress I wanted to use
customer_reviews.author: cassie

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and sharp.
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy and sharp out of the box makes easy peeling trees.
customer_reviews.author: Wesley Revel

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, very well built. Heavy, feels like it will last, and the blade will take many, many sharpening she.
customer_reviews.author: DC1013

customer_reviews.title: Awful
customer_reviews.text: Pros? It's built heavy. Cons? Didn't come with even a clean grind to the blade, had to spend over an hour sharpening it. The steel is very easy to file down, definitely NOT 30 Rockwell hardness. The black of the blade edge is not even clean and has a slight round to it. Meaning the entire blade edge needs to be reground. The "blade guard" is a simple strip of rubber that does not hold to the blade at all. My verdict? This is what I would expect from a 5$ tool not a 25$ one.
customer_reviews.author: Lasivian Leandros

customer_reviews.title: No Cut
customer_reviews.text: Didn't cut the wood logs, the only job for this tool. Not good.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Grimes

customer_reviews.title: Good quality product at a realistic price
customer_reviews.text: Good quality product at a realistic price...remember, it's a Draw Knife NOT a Shaving Razor. I made a Snap On leather sheath easily and it's now in my kit..
customer_reviews.author: A J W Prescott

customer_reviews.title: Ready to use, works great
customer_reviews.text: Got this little beauty and was surprised to find a decent edge in place instead of a rough form that needed sharpening. Stripped the bark off a Black Locust tree I'd cut down. A good solid tool that I expect to be using for 30 years or more.
customer_reviews.author: John Freiler

customer_reviews.title: Good design and very sharp.
customer_reviews.text: Very sharp and good handle angles. Once you get the hang of it, the bark flies off quick.
customer_reviews.author: Brett Myzer

customer_reviews.title: Use
customer_reviews.text: It was easy to use and stripped the wood very quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Ellen Collingwood

customer_reviews.title: ... know a whole lot about them but this seems like a decent place to start for a draw knife
customer_reviews.text: I'm just breaking into hand tools so I don't know a whole lot about them but this seems like a decent place to start for a draw knife. It is made in China but it does hold an edge and get the job done. I've debarked a few pieces of firewood just to try it and then used it for a canoe paddle I built.
customer_reviews.author: Drew Lys

customer_reviews.title: Good for stripping batk
customer_reviews.text: Ripped bark of no problem. After multiple uses the edge is still sharp
customer_reviews.author: Heidi

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Says it comes sharpened is extremely Dull. Not taking an edge, easily Fine other than
customer_reviews.author: BKshopper

customer_reviews.title: Good size
customer_reviews.text: Works well for 4-10" logs. Any bigger than that is too big, but it's a nice size for peeling fence posts.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Dull... Very dull
customer_reviews.text: It wasn't sharp at all out of the box. I spent a good 30 minutes touching up the edge and it does take on quite a sharp edge. It's good for the price but you'll spend what you saved in sharpening it.
customer_reviews.author: Jose Garnica

customer_reviews.title: High value, low cost draw knife.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great draw knife. The handles are easily removable from the blade for sharpening, and cleaning, but they don't come loose while working. All in all, this is a great bang for your buck.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Clark

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Not bad to use at all. Im new to woodworking and this isn’t hard at all
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worked better than expected
customer_reviews.text: I was not optimistic when I read some of the reviews but this worked far better and easier than I expected. I used it to strip off the bark from a birch log. I only did minor sharpening with a sharpener from a kitchen knife set before using. I probably didn't need to.
customer_reviews.author: E.L

customer_reviews.title: great tree canker removal
customer_reviews.text: great planer I use mostly in the garden trimming bark and any trunk canker I find on my ornamental trees, mostly Japanese maples.
customer_reviews.author: Jadehawk

customer_reviews.title: Nuts come loose
customer_reviews.text: Needs locking nuts on the end- they come loose as you use the blade
customer_reviews.author: ted ewoldt

customer_reviews.title: Seems acceptable quality, came extremely dull
customer_reviews.text: This is great, after I spent some time properly sharpening it. Came very dull, to the point it may have been useless as it was.
customer_reviews.author: Revrant

customer_reviews.title: Was a little disappointed at how dull it was when it arrived
customer_reviews.text: Works well after I spent an hour or more sharpening and honing it. Was a little disappointed at how dull it was when it arrived, but ya get what ya pay for.
customer_reviews.author: LJ

customer_reviews.title: ... minutes to figure out the proper angle for the best draw but once I got it
customer_reviews.text: Took a few minutes to figure out the proper angle for the best draw but once I got it, it was good. Maybe not a professionals tool but it does the job for what I need it for.
customer_reviews.author: Jon H

customer_reviews.title: Best draw knife for the cost.
customer_reviews.text: It's just as dicribed, I used it right out of the box, dose a great job taking bark off my cedar logs. I would recommend this product to anyone, if your looking for a draw knife you can't beat this one for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Clayton L.

customer_reviews.title: good sharp steel and feels great in
customer_reviews.text: as ordered, good sharp steel and feels great in hands
customer_reviews.author: tommy redden

customer_reviews.title: What a neat tool!
customer_reviews.text: I can handle it, and enjoy using it for misc projects.
customer_reviews.author: C. T.....   GA

customer_reviews.title: Works great. Very sharp and easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: I used this to pull bark off of birch trees so I could make natural repellent. Bark came right off with this tool. Super easy to do.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Sim

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done,  but poor design
customer_reviews.text: Expect to spend a lot of time on your first sharpening. While I don't expect any tool to be ready straight out of the box, I do expect that the edge of a straight bladed tool wouldn't look like a serrated edge. Second problem I discovered was because of the shape of the handles, the tool lifts off of the grinder's tool rest toward the outside edges of the blade during sharpening. As a result, I can really only sharpen the center 3" or so. That being said, once it's sharpened it does make quick work of stripping bark from slabs. Next time I'll look for something that can be sharpened edge to edge on a grinding wheel.
customer_reviews.author: James822

customer_reviews.title: does the job
customer_reviews.text: cheaply made handles but i wasn't expecting anything fancy, the blade is just a sharpened piece of carbon steel. all in all it does what it says it does, would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: chase

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Needed to be sharpened right out of box as it arrived with the cutting edge more serrated than sharp.
customer_reviews.author: P. Baer

customer_reviews.title: Works fine if you know what you are doing.
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy drawknife for the price. Had to knock paint off and sharpen it a little, but I've never bought a cheap tool that didn't need at least a little preparation work. Works fine if you use it for its intended purpose, obviously won't work for random other woodworking tasks.
customer_reviews.author: Jess

customer_reviews.title: He edge was not very good( had nicks in the ...
customer_reviews.text: He edge was not very good( had nicks in the edge). I had to remove all the black paint that was on it in order to properly sharpen
customer_reviews.author: Scot

customer_reviews.title: Good value, works out of the box but dulled ...
customer_reviews.text: Good value, works out of the box but dulled quickly and needed to be sharpened. Debarked about 40 feet of cedar and carved a few tenons with it before it was too dull to do anything.
customer_reviews.author: C. Le

customer_reviews.title: Great tool. Great Price. Great arm workout.
customer_reviews.text: I managed to strip all of the beams for an authentic hand-peeled viga constructed palapa. (12' x 22', yea, it's massive) Turned out great. Still razor-sharp and ready for more peeling!
customer_reviews.author: The Ras

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Haven't had it long, but it is a good price and only a bit of sharpening got the blade working well, a grid stone gets it there a lot quicker.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea MF

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money just buy it!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: this is a fine draw knife for the money. Mine came sharp and ready to go with no issues. I will for sure be buying some extras.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Mintz

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and comfortable handles
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and comfortable handles. The material hardness requires it to be sharpened more than I'd it to be but the results when sharp are excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Michael F.

customer_reviews.title: Great drawknife
customer_reviews.text: Used it for peeling park off of oak branches and apple branches. Does the job
customer_reviews.author: Santhosh

customer_reviews.title: Great,, solid well made
customer_reviews.text: Great ,,solid well made , nice . good product would buy other tools from this CO. won't buy this one again cause it'll be around in my shop for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Cathleen Bowne

customer_reviews.title: Good quality for the price
customer_reviews.text: The quality for the price is pretty good works great for what I'm using it for stripping bark off of walking sticks.
customer_reviews.author: Juan Pena

customer_reviews.title: Ergonomical, Efficient, Durable
customer_reviews.text: The only drawback on the draw knife is that it's made in China.
customer_reviews.author: Michael A.

customer_reviews.title: Bow Tough!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best tool and size for reducing an osage stave.
customer_reviews.author: DAVID SHAW

customer_reviews.title: sturdy and affordable
customer_reviews.text: My husband LOVES this knife. He has used it on multiple projects and it really has done a great job. After looking at MULTIPLE draw knives we are happy that we purchased this one. It's durable and of great quality.
customer_reviews.author: Robin Campbell

customer_reviews.title: ... durable but it came with an edge that was dull, chipped
customer_reviews.text: Product is durable but it came with an edge that was dull, chipped, and unfinished. It can be improved with sharpening but be aware that if you buy this knife, you may need to put some sharpening work into it.
customer_reviews.author: Corey

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I spent a few hours sharpening it but it works good
customer_reviews.author: Fredric J. Kern

customer_reviews.title: Had a friend sharpen it good for me
customer_reviews.text: This serves my purpose well. Had a friend sharpen it good for me, as others say it wasn't sharp when I got it. I could see that for someone who uses it a lot they may want a better knife, but as I said it is great for me.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Adams

customer_reviews.title: Great Tool, Solid and Works Fine
customer_reviews.text: Arrived in perfect shape. Useful for my needs. Solidly built.
customer_reviews.author: John H.

customer_reviews.title: Timber Turff Draw shave tool
customer_reviews.text: The Timber Turff Draw shave tool works grate for what i'm using it for. Good price for what you get.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Draw Knife
customer_reviews.text: It has worked well for me since I got it. I would recommend this draw knife.
customer_reviews.author: Val Davenport

customer_reviews.title: Pube Annihilator!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best shaving tool thing in the world. Nothing handles my pubes like this baby!
customer_reviews.author: Mike Hubbell

product_meta.title: Timber Tuff TMB-08DS Straight Draw Shave Tool, 8"
product_meta.description: Color:WoodTimber Tuff’s TMB-08DS 8” Straight Draw Shave Tool is the perfect tool for debarking logs, firewood, fence posts, and more. The 8” ultra-sharp blade is 5 mm thick with a 30° angle shaves bark and wood accurately with very little effort. Made of heavy-duty steel with a hardness of HRC 30, this draw shave is designed to be durable and reliable. The comfortable wood handles provide you with a secure hold while the included blade protector will keep the blade sharp and will also help protect you. To keep the draw shave sharp and accurate, simply re-sharpen the blade with a stone when needed. Timber Tuff’s draw shave is the ideal and reliable tool for your debarking needs and is also perfect for furniture building.
feature_bullets: Sharp 8” straight blade, 5 mm thick with a 30° angle for fast and accurate work
Designed with a long-lasting and durable steel blade with a hardness of HRC 30 for a reliable product
Wood grip handles are comfortable and provide you with a secure hold; the included blade protector keeps the blade sharp and protects the user
Easily shaves wood from logs, wood, fence posts, and more
Ideal for building furniture; 1 year limited Manufacturer's parts warranty
